name: Tansy Ragwort - Senecio jacobaea
description: Herbaceous perennial reaching up to 4 feet in height with clusters of yellow, daisy-like flowerheads.
appearance: Herbaceous, biennial or short-lived perennial that reaches 8 in. to 3 ft. in height
In the first year a basal rosette of lobed leaves with a ruffled appearance is produced. Leaves range from 1.5-8 inches long and 0.75 to 2.25 inches wide
Stems branch near the top to bear numerous, yellow, daisy-like flowerheads. Tansy ragwort flowers from July through October
Each flower is composed of a central cluster of disc flowers surrounded by 10 to 15 ray flowers.
Fruits are light brown in color and very small (0.08 inch). Some seeds have a pappus (tuft of fluff like a dandelion seed) that aids in dispersion by wind.
This plant contains pyrrolizidine alkaloids which are toxic to cattle and horses.
